pros: Valued mission, reasonable pay, flexible time off
cons: Not enough help, over load on work

pros: Great Coworkers Good Experience Helping Community
cons: HR and Upper Management were not too structured

pros: I just loved working at PCHC. I felt as though they were always understanding and it was such a great group of people that I worked with. Everyone was about providing the best healthcare we could offer to our patients.
cons: One of the downsides of working at PCHC was the high provider turnover rate. Sometimes you’d just figure out how to rub one provider for them to leave and you to have to start fresh again. Also, I felt that the training was lacking at times.

pros: great company all around, very enjoyable place to work
cons: there really are no cons that I can think of everyone is very friendly and helps when a question is asked.

pros: Patient Access is top priority

pros: Easy to take time off
cons: Things are always changing. New people come frequently and try to change things.

job_title: Lead Human Resources Business Partner in Bangor, ME
pros: Great work-life balance, flexibility, Executive and Senior Leadership listens and communicates well, and the mission of the organization.
cons: I would like to see more added to the benefits package such as paid parental leave and more funding toward the 403(b).

pros: Company's mission, insurance and dental insurance
cons: Doesn't pay enough, always being asked to do more than your share

review_title: Engaging, fast-paced, feel-good place to work.

pros: Really care about a work life balance

pros:
Great population to work with 
Most of the coworkers are caring and helpful
Multidisciplinary teams
cons:
Middle management ignores staff needs, only tells upper management what they want to hear
Bullies get awards and promoted while many who work hard and are caring  are pushed out

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Old Town, ME
pros: Co-worker were an outstanding crew to work with and for, managers are flexible and personable, good benefits and relatively easy to get time off when needed.
cons: Occasionally it could get catty in the office, but that's seen nearly everywhere. As long as you didn't get wrapped up in it you wouldn't typically notice it.

job_title: Payment Applications Specialist in Bangor, ME
pros: Flexibility with hours and time off
cons: Allowing themselves to be taken advantage of with so many employees out on one form of disability or another and expecting remaining employees to pick up the slack.

review_title: As long as the funding streams didn't dry out, it was a great place to work.
job_title: Web Portal Coordinator in Bangor, ME
pros: Work environment and office was pleasant.
cons: -Dependant upon federal and state monies to exist.

pros: Great team oriented environment, mission driven. New CEO very committed to creating a successful organization.  Lots of flexibility in all but the telecommunications policy.
cons: Pay can be slightly below market in some cases.

job_title: Medical Support Assistant in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Wait, there was pros for working with this company!? I have to put 20 words for this... I was able to watch movies while I worked...
cons: Management doesn’t know how to manage employees, the hourly wage was crap for what we had to go through, crappy insurance. Nothing was offered if we brought friends on.
